title: ES6 - Import a Default Export
content: In the last challenge, you learned about export default and its uses. To import a default export, you need to use a different import syntax. In the following example, add is the deafult export of the math_functions.js file. Here is how to import it:

The syntax differs in one key place. The imported value, add, is not surrounded by curly braces ({}). add here is simply a variable name for whatever the default export of the math_functions.js file is. You can use many name here when importing a default.

instruction: In the following code, import the default export from the math_functions.js file, found in the same directory as this file. Give the import the name subtract.
placeholder: // Only change code above this line

hint: You should properly import subtract from math_functions.js
